basics.name: Mario Amé
basics.label: Digital Designer
basics.summary: As a passionate digital designer, I blend creativity and technology to craft impactful user experiences. My expertise spans UI/UX design and multimedia content, collaborating with cross-functional teams to create innovative solutions. I prioritize functionality and user satisfaction while pushing creative boundaries. With experience in leading QA initiatives and producing engaging audiovisual content, I adapt to various challenges. My goal is to create innovative digital experiences that inspire and connect users with brands, driving meaningful interactions in the digital landscape.

work.name: Freelance
work.summary: Led various design projects, strengthening client relationships by adapting to local culture. Managed projects and accounts, handling commercial negotiations and delivering end-to-end graphic and web design solutions.
highlights: Stay current in design by challenging myself to produce compelling outcomes.
responsibilities: Project and Account Management, including commercial negotiations with clients
achievements: Assisted in establishing the brand identity for an industrial importing SME in Hamilton.
Redesigned the brand guidelines for a major fuel benefits card in Auckland.
Designed a prominent front-of-house banner for a leading recruitment agency in Auckland, visible from the street.

work.name: Álterego Agency
work.summary: Acted as main designer and head of IT projects, conceptualizing advertisements, designing audiovisual pieces as well as directing teams and projects.
highlights: Worked with a high-octane team fulled with creative and technical specialities to design and develop our projects.
responsibilities: End-to-end design and development of advertising campaigns.
Production of Audiovisual assets for social media and campaigns.
Project and Account manager, including commercial negotiation with clients.
Audiovisual producer and a campaign strategy consultant.
achievements: Compromiso Foundation: Co-designed the concept for the award-winning advertising campaign #PoniendoseLaCamisetaDelFuturo by @PotreroDigital.

Da Vinci School: Co-produced the audiovisual pieces for BitBang-Fest 2020 and developed the visual identity, branding, and graphic and audiovisual content for social networks, YouTube, and the internal streaming platform.

Domingo Granja S.A.: Coordinated end to end project, from hiring designers through developing the full planning. Successfully launched the re-branding and Brand Manual including clothing and signage applications, and a new institutional website.

work.name: Landrú Foundation
work.summary: Head of the Digital office, leading the development of its main product, the 'Landrú library,' a repository of the artist's artwork.
responsibilities: Led the development and launch of the Landrú Library ('Landruteca), a digital repository showcasing the artist’s artwork and comics.
Collaborated closely with the Foundation Director to define and manage the scope of IT, multimedia, and digital design projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
Directed a multidisciplinary team of developers, analysts, and a UI designer, coordinating efforts to meet project milestones and ensuring on-time delivery.
Conducted technical feasibility assessments for digital projects, identifying key roles and skills necessary for project completion.
achievements: Successfully launched Landruteca v2, enhancing access to the artist's work with an updated interface and categorized content, facilitating media distribution and internal use.
Revitalized the organization’s digital presence by implementing the official website, landru.org, which adopted a newspaper-style format to engage both modern and traditional audiences.

work.name: Argentine Ministry of Production Development
work.summary: Producer for a government program aimed to provide webinars of topics of interest for SMEs.
responsibilities: Produced and facilitated virtual training sessions (webinars) for the Academia PyME Program, focusing on essential topics for small and medium enterprises (SMEs). Academia PyME Program: https://www.argentina.gob.ar/produccion/capacitacion.
Coordinated scheduling and logistics, including selecting trainers/coaches for each session and providing technical assistance for live streaming platforms.
achievements: Collaborated in the successful implementation of a dynamic schedule, delivering three online webinars per week across various topics, enhancing training accessibility for SMEs.
Earned national recognition for the program's success from senior stakeholders, showcasing the positive impact on SME development nationwide.

work.name: Freelance
work.summary: Worked closely with clients, I’ve developed tailored solutions including Banners, book covers, stationery, brand books and more.
responsibilities: Collaborated with clients to create tailored visual solutions, enhancing brand recognition and engagement through high-quality designs.
Managed the complete project lifecycle from initial concept to final delivery, ensuring adherence to timelines and budgets.
achievements:
Gutierrez Hospital: Developed a comprehensive brand manual and guidelines for a prominent volunteer service within a public hospital, strengthening their visual identity. 
 View: https://www.behance.net/gallery/152780691/Manual-de-Marca-Voluntarias-del-Hospital-Gutierrez

SPIKA Brewery: Created an eye-catching beer can design for an emerging brewery in Argentina, contributing to their market presence. 
 View: https://www.behance.net/gallery/175796205/Beer-can-design-Spika-Beer-Company
Designed various promotional materials including stationery, flyers, book covers, banners, signs, and clothing for a diverse clientele.

volunteer.summary: Volunteer coach for the YES Kickstart events in the Wellington Region. Acted as a personal entrepreneurship coach for teams of high school students in the YES program, conducting three coaching sessions.
highlights: Assisted over 50 students over the course of sessions.

volunteer.summary: Developed the okif.org webpage for the foundation, which aims to network and empower graduates from the Otto Krause High School in Buenos Aires worldwide. Additionally, led the development of the organization’s internal database, including its API integration.

projects.name: Personal Portfolio as Web designer
projects.description: A personal portfolio focusing on my UI and web skills
highlights: Built with plain Js and Css

projects.name: Personal Portfolio as a generalist designer
projects.description: A personal portfolio website to showcase my projects and skills.
highlights: Built with plain Js and Css
Includes my projects categorized, and a little integration with Hugging face's GPT2
